name: Action
author: Total.js
readme:
This component creates similar functionality as Total.js Actions.

## Payload

```js
{
	ip: String, // optional, IP address
	url: String, // optional
	language: String, // optional
	ua: String, // optional, parsed user-agent
	user: Object, // optional
	headers: { key: String }, // optional, request headers
	cookies: { key: String }, // optional, cookies
	payload: {}, // optional, request payload
	query: { key: String }, // optional
	params: { key: String }, // optional
	files: [{ type: String, filename: String, path: String, ext: String, size: Number, width: Number, height: Number }] // optional
}
```

## Custom scripting

- supports `await`
- supports Total.js global functions

__Properties__:

- `$.model {Object}` or `model` parsed payload
- `$.query {Object}` parsed URL query arguments
- `$.params {Object}` parsed URL params
- `$.cookies {Object}` parsed cookies
- `$.files [Object]` uploaded files
- `$.user {Object}` user session (optional)
- `$.headers {Object}` request headers
- `$.ip {String}` IP address (optional)
- `$.language {String}` optional
- `$.ua {String}` parsed user agent (optional)
- `$.url {String}` URL endpoint
- `$.message {Object}` Flow message instance
- `$.request {Object}` Flow message payload data

__Methods__:

- `$.invalid(error)` responds with an error and ends the action
- `$.success([value])` responds with `{ success: true, value }` object and ends the action
- `$.callback(value)` responds with `value` object and ends the action
- `$.cancel()` ends the action without response
- `$.audit(message, [type])` writes audit

## Supported types

- `string`
- `number`
- `boolean`
- `date`
- `object`
- `email`
- `phone`
- `zip`
- `base64`
- `url`
- `datauri`
- `json`
- `lower`
- `upper`
- `capitalize` all words
- `capitalize2` only first word
- `name` makes a name (capitalizes words and remove special characters)
- `zip`
- `uid`
- `guid`
- `color`
- `icon`
- `search` prepares string to a search string
- `safestring` checks XSS and SQL Injections
- `smallint`
- `tinyint`
- `{A|B|C}` enum type
- `[type]` means array
- `{ name:String, age:Number }` means nested object
- `[ name:String, age:Number ]` means array with an object
- `*something:type` is `required` field

name: API Router
author: Total.js
readme:
This component routes incoming Total.js API data according to the defined API schema. The component extends input data (query, payload and params) with parsed data.

__Input & Output data__:

```js
{
	// REQUIRED payload:
	payload: {
		schema: 'schema_name/{param_1}/{param_2}?query=arguments',
		data: {} // optional, request payload
	},
	ip: String, // optional, IP address
	url: String, // optional
	language: String, // optional
	ua: String, // optional, parsed UA
	user: Object, // optional
	headers: { key: String }, // optional, request headers
	cookies: { key: String }, // optional, cookies
	query: { key: String }, // optional
	params: { key: String }, // optional
	files: [{ type: String, filename: String, path: String, ext: String, size: Number, width: Number, height: Number }] // optional
}
```

In the case of  `error`, the input data is extended by the `response` property with an error.

name: Auth token
author: Total.js
readme: This component must be used only with REST Route component. It reads a token from the request header and compares it with the token declared in the configuration.

name: Captcha
author: Total.js
readme:
Captcha image generator generates a simple JPEG image. It utilizes the [Total.js Weather API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#Ii6INR1cR61f).

__Input data:__

```js
// {String} Captcha text
'123456'
```

__Output data__:

```js
// Returns DataURI
'data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4AAQSkZ...''

```

name: ChatGPT
author: Total.js

name: ChatGPT
author: Total.js
readme:
By using this component you can asks ChatGPT / OpenAPI. It utilizes the [Total.js ChatGPT API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#128fm001kc51d).

__Input data:__

```js
// {String} a question for ChatGPT
'What is Total.js Platform'
```

__Output data__:

If `output` is set as Text:
```js
{
    text: 'Total.js Platform is a web development platform that provides a comprehensive set of tools and modules for building modern, scalable, and high-performance web applications. It is based on the Node.js runtime and offers a seamless development experience with a powerful, intuitive, and easy-to-use framework. Total.js Platform includes features such as database integration, real-time communication, server-side rendering, RESTful API support, and more. It also supports various front-end technologies and integrates seamlessly with popular third-party libraries and services, making it a great choice for building full-stack web applications.'
}
```

If `output` is set as Image:
Returns data according to the component configuration Response type. It can be `Buffer`, `Base64` or `DataURI`.

name: Check credits

readme:
Returns a current status for your token. It utilizes the [Total.js Check API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#6d397001td51c).

__Output data__:

```js
{
    credits: 34.49
}
```

name: Check VAT
author: Total.js
readme:
Determines whether is a company VAT payer or no. Works only in European Union. It utilizes the [Total.js Check VAT API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#6d385001lt51c).

__Input data:__

```js
// {String} VAT ID
'SK2120417167'
```

__Output data__:

```js
{
    is: true, // Is VAT Payer?
    vat: 20,  // Country VAT
    name: 'Total Avengers s. r. o.',
    address: 'Viestova 6784/28\n97401 Banská Bystrica\nSlovensko'
}
```

name: Cheerio
author: Total.js

name: Code
author: Total.js
readme:
This component executes a custom JavaScript code as it is.

To send data to the default output use `send(somedata);`
To send data to specific output when number of outputs > 1 use `$.send('outputX', somedata)` where `X` is output index, see example bellow:
- first output--> `send(somedata)` or `$.send('output', somedata)`
- second output --> `$.send('output2', somedata)`
- ...
- 5th output --> `$.send('output5', somedata)`
- etc.

name: Comment
author: Total.js
readme: This component renders a small markdown comment inside the body.

name: Confirmation code
author: Total.js
readme:
This component can help you with generating confirmation codes. Keep data structure for inputs according to the documentation below.

### `create` input/output

__Create input__:

- `id {String}` identifier (email, phone number, identifier, etc.)
- `param {String}` a custom parameter

__Create output__:

- `success {Boolean}` determines if the code is verified or not accroding to its identifier
- `value {String}` a pin/code/token
- `param {String}` a custom parameter (it sends only if the value is true)
- `error {String}` (optional) a simple error identifier, it can contain:
	- `locked` the identifier is locked by the previous call

### `verify` input/output

__Verify input__:

- `id {String}` identifier (email, phone number, identifier, etc.)
- `value {String}` a pin/code/token

__Verify output__:

- `success {Boolean}` determines if the code is verified or not accroding to its identifier
- `slots {Number}` free slots/attempts
- `error {String}` (optional) a simple error identifier, it can contain:
	- `invalid` the code is invalid
	- `404` identifier not found

---

### Settings

- __Lock__ prevents overwriting of the code according to the identifier

name: console.log()
author: Total.js
readme: This component prints a message into the console.

name: CORS

name: Counter
author: Total.js
readme: The component counts incoming messages.

name: Crontab
author: Peter Širka / Total.js
readme:
The component can make a trigger in the specific time and date.

## Cron string: `* * * * *`

Meaning of each `*` explained bellow, in order from left to right:

- minute `0 - 59`
- hour `0 - 23`
- day of month `1 - 31`
- month `1 - 12`
- day of week `0 - 6` and `0` is Sunday

```
0 16 * * *      -> trigger every day at 16:00
20 19 * * *     -> every day at 19:20 and 19:40
* * * * *       -> trigger every minute
0 20 * * 1      -> every monday at 20:00
```

name: CSV Dataset
author: Peter Širka
readme:
The component stores data as CSV Dataset for e.g. Dashboard application. Dataset is stored in `/private/` path that is available with the help of the Flow access token.

CSV file contains only processed values (according to the period) and the `.meta` file contains meta data + last value.

__Input for data processing__:

```js
{
	key: String,    // optional, e.g. device_id | device_name
	value: Number   // measured value
}
```

### CSV columns

- `a` = `key {String}`
- `b` = `value {Number}`
- `c` = `min {Number}`
- `d` = `max {Number}`
- `e` = `sum {Number}`
- `f` = `count {Number}`
- `g` = `tshour {Number}`in the form `yyyyMMddhh`
- `h` = `tsday {Number}` in the form `yyyyMMdd`
- `i` = `tsweek {Number}` in the form `yyyyww`
- `j` = `tsmonth {Number}` in the form `yyyyMM`
- `k` = `tsyear {Number}` in the form `yyyy`

name: Extend
author: Total.js
readme: This component extends the current message by adding new properties.

name: Feed to delay
author: Total.js
readme:
The incomming message will only be forwarded after the timeout. Only the last message is forwarded, so any previously received messages are lost.
If messages are comming in within the given timeout period this component will never forward any message.
The timeout is activated by the first message.
The maximum timeout is 2147483 seconds, which is about 24.8 days.
Example usage:
	- A sensor is supposed to send data every minute, use this component to notify you that there is a problem with receiving message.
	- HTTP request comes in and it takes too much time to respond? Use this component to notify you about it.

name: Forward

name: Logger

readme: The component logs incoming messages into the Total.js Cloud Logger.

name: Macro
author: Total.js
readme:
The macro component uses Total.js Macro language that allows you to write much simple code like in JavaScript. Macros are targeted for small data transformation.

- you don't need to solve Upper/Lower case
- `return EXPRESSION` will return data and send them next
- `data` keyword contains a message data
- `temp` keyword can contain a persistent temporary data

__Example__:

```text
IF DATA>20 AND DATA<35
	RETURN DATA * 5
FI
```

name: Map array
author: Total.js
readme:
This component can iterate over an array and only take properties listed in the configuration. __The input must be an array of objects!__

### Example data

```js
[
	{ sensor: { temperature: 25, humidity: 50, ... some more properties }},
	{ sensor: { temperature: 24, humidity: 55, ... some more properties }},
	{ sensor: { temperature: 23, humidity: 60, ... some more properties }}
]
```
### Example configuration

- `sensor.temperature` -> `temp`
- `sensor.humidity` -> `hum`

### Example output

```js
[
	{ temp: 25, hum: 50 },
	{ temp: 24, hum: 55 },
	{ temp: 23, hum: 60 }
]
```

If `Return an Array of Arrays` is checked then
each of the Map properties will be pushed to a new array, see example bellow

### Example given the data above and this configuration:

`Return an Array of Arrays` -> **checked**

**Map**:

- `sensor.temperature`
- `sensor.humidity`

### Example output:

```js
[
	[25, 50],
	[24, 55],
	[23, 60],
]
```

readme: The component merges incoming data into an array.

name: Modify
author: Total.js
readme:
This component allows you to set/modify/move/remove properties of the incomming data.
For eaxample, to set the message data to a string `Hello world` select *Message data* in the rule dropdown and leave the text field empty.
Then in the bellow dropdown select `string` and enter the desired string in the text field.

__Result:__

- before: $.data -> 'Hello world'
- after:  $.data -> 'New string'

## Expression

Available params are: `data`, `repo`, `variables` ,`variables2`
Where data is message.data, repo is message.repo --> [Documentation](https://docs.totaljs.com/total4/40844001ni51c)
And variables are local variables which can be set in the Variables dialog accessible on the main toolbar(the button between Plus icon and Bug icon)
For example, we want message data to be the value of (data.value + variables.offset)

__Result:__

- before: $.data --> `{ value: 100 }` / variables --> `{ offset: 20, ... many other properties }`
- after:  $.data -> `{ value: 120 }`

The expression: `data.value + variables.offset`

### Important

- `Remove` -> `Message data / Message repo` -> `<empty path>` will set `Message data / Message repo` to `null`;
- `Remove` -> `Local variables / Global variables` -> `<empty path>` will be ignored but `Remove` -> `Local variables / Global variables` -> `myVar` will work.
- `Set` -> `Message data` -> `some.path` to: `Message data` -> `some.other.path` will add another property to the incoming data and rest of the data will remain untouched
- `Set` -> `Message data` -> `<empty path>` to: `Message data` -> `some.path` will essentialy overwrite the incomming data, after this there's no longer access to original data(same goes for repo)

name: MongoDB Insert
author: Martin Smola
readme:
## Input

Example
```javascript
{
    database: 'database-name',
    collection: 'collection-name',
	data: { ... },  // data to insert, object for `insertOne` and an array of objects for `insertMany`
	options: { ... }// insert options as passed to `insertOne(data, options)` or `insertMany(data, options)`
}
```

name: MongoDB Query
author: Martin Smola
readme:
Uses mquery under the hood. Here is the [documentation](https://www.npmjs.com/package/mquery)

## Input

Example
```javascript
{
    database: 'database-name',
    collection: 'collection-name',
	data: <any> // this prop will be passed into the query function
}
```

## Query editor
```js
// query; mquery instance
// data; data from the incomming object

return query.find(); // return all documents
```

## Important
In the `.select()` you cannot use inclusion and exclusion together.
This is invalid: `.select('firstname -lastname')`
Valid exclusion: `.select('-lastname')` or `.select('-email -lastname')` etc.
Valid inclusion: `.select('name email')` or `.select('email lastname')` etc.

author: Martin Smola

name: MQTT Subscribe
author: Martin Smola
readme: MQTT Subscribe

name: MySQL
author: Total.js
readme:
## Input

Expected data:

```javascript
{
	query: 'SELECT * FROM tblname;'
}
```

name: NoSQL
author: Total.js
readme:
## Outputs
- response from nosql engine
## Settings
- collection: (optional) if not set, incomming data object must have a 'collection' property set
- method: (optional) if not set, incomming data object must have a 'method' property set
## Input
```javascript
{
	collection: 'users', // optional, will override settings value
	method: 'query', // insert|read|query|update|remove - optional, will override settings value
	// for insert, update
	data: { ... },
	// for query, read, update, remove
	filter: [
		['where', 'sensor', 'temp'], // builder.where('sensor', 'temp');
		['limit', 2]                 // builder.limit(2);
	],
	upsert: true // only for update, if set then document will be inserted if it doesn't exist
	addid: true  // only for insert and update, if set then id prop will be automaticaly generated (for update only when upsert is also set)
}
```
## Insert
- inserts recieved data
- expects data to be an Object
- returns error, success, id
## Read
- returns first document found
- requires `filter`
- returns error, response
## Update
- updates document(s)
- expects data to be an Object with all the props to be updated
- requires `filter`
- returns error, response
- if response is 0 then update failed
## Remove
- removes document
- requires `filter`
- returns error, response
- if response is 0 then remove failed
## Query
- returns all documents found
- requires `filter`
- returns error, response

name: Notify
author: Total.js
readme:
This component captures data on the `/notify/` endpoint.

__Output data__:

```js
{
	"method": String,
	"query": Object,
	"body": Object,
	"headers": Object,
	"cookies": Object,
	"url": String,
	"ip": String
}
```

name: OAuth 2.0
author: Total.js
readme: This component can obtain OAuth 2.0 access token from 3rd party service.

name: Object
author: Total.js
readme:
The component creates an object from the defined string (Tangular) template. With the help of the Tangular template engine, you can use conditions, loops, etc..

__Available markup__:

- `{{ data.key }}` represents data
- `{{ variables.key }}` represents local and global Flow variables
- `{{ hostname }}` contains a current URL address to the main Flow app `{String}`
- `{{ url }}` contains a current URL address to the current Flow `{String}`
- `{{ env }}` contains a current environment `{String}`

name: OCR
author: Total.js
readme:
OCR reader for `JPG`, `PNG` or `PDF` files. It utilizes the [Total.js OCR API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#If83x81cy61f).

__Input data:__
```js
// {String} dataURI of a file
"data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgo....."
```

__Output data:__
```js
{
	text: 'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do...'
}
```

name: OpenSync
author: Total.js
readme:
This component receives a data from the [OpenSync](https://docs.totaljs.com/opensync/) app. Data example:

```js
{
	id: String,              // Internal ID
	type: String,            // Parsed content-type (can be empty with the "GET" method)
	channel: String,         // Channel
	ip: String,              // Host IP address
	method: String,          // HTTP method (upper-case)
	headers: Object,         // Key:value
	query: Object,           // Key:value
	body: Object,            // JSON/key:value/String
	ua: String,              // Parsed user-agent
	files: [Object Array]    // Uploaded files { filename: String, extension: String, type: String, size: Number, url: String, width: Number, height: Number }
}
```

name: OpenWeather
author: Total.js
readme:
This component can retieve weather data from [OpenWheatherMap](https://openweathermap.org/api/);

__Input__:

```js
	{
		query: String,         // Optional, City name, Country code, State code e.g: London, Ouagadougou, sk
		lon: String,           // Optional, Longitude
		lat: String,           // Optional, Latitude
		lang: String,          // Optional, Output language e.g: `en`, `de`, `sk`, `fr` etc...
		units: String,         // Optional, standard, metric, imperial
		date: String           // Optional,  Timestamp (Unix time, UTC time zone), e.g. date=1586468027
	}
```

name: Output
author: Total.js
readme: The component can send data from an encapsulated FlowStream.

name: Plate number parser
author: Total.js

name: PostgreSQL
author: Peter Širka | Total.js
readme: This component checks PostgreSQL database connection.

name: PostgreSQL
author: Total.js
readme:
PostgreSQL

## Input
Expected data:
```javascript
{
	query: 'SELECT * FROM tblname;'
}
```
Output:
```javascript
{
	command: 'INSERT', // SELECT, etc.
	rows: [], // 
	rowCount: 1
}
```

name: Print
author: Total.js
readme: The component prints incoming data in a JSON format.

name: Print JSON
author: Martin Smola
readme: The component prints incoming data in a JSON format.

name: Print PDF
author: Total.js
readme:
Prints HTML or URL address to PDF, JPG, PNG or DOCX file. It utilizes the [Total.js Print API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#6c225001ga51c). __Input data:__ ```js // {String} HTML content or URL address '

HTML content

' ``` __Output data:__ Returns data according to the component configuration `Response type`. It can be `Buffer`, `Base64` or `DataURI`.

name: Publish
author: Total.js
readme: The component publish the data to the specific `Input` component.

name: QR Code
author: Peter Širka / Total.js
readme:
The component generates QR Code.

__Input data__:

```js
{
	text: String
}
```

__Output data__:

```js
{
	text: String,
	data: 'Data URL - BASE64'
}
```

name: QueryBuilder PG
author: Total.js
readme:
The component initializes QueryBuilder for the PostgreSQL database. So you can use the 'API Database` component. Each connection must be separated by an alias.

__Usage in API Database__:

- `tbl_user` is targeted to the `default/tbl_user` alias connection
- `anotherserver/tbl_user` will use `anotherserver` alias connection

name: Queue
author: Total.js
readme: A simple persistent queue for the incomming messages.

name: Read
author: Total.js
readme: This component reads specific values according to the configured map.

name: Redirect
author: Total.js
readme:
## Input

Incomming data have higher priority than the values set in the Configuration form. Both the `url` and `permanent` are optional.

```js
{
	url: 'https://example.com',
	permanent: true|false
}
```

name: Remember
author: Total.js
readme:
The primary goal of this component is to remember the data. The component contains two inputs:

- Remember input for remembering data.
- Request input as a trigger for obtaining data, then remembered data would extend the request message (its data), and the component would send it to the response output.

name: Renderer
author: Total.js
readme: The component transforms data in HTML format in the component body. You can easily visualize any data. Data is rendered server-side.

name: Response
author: Total.js
readme: This component can respond to an HTTP request.

name: Route
author: Total.js
readme:
This component registers an HTTP Route and sends request data next. It stores `controller` instance in the `message.refs.controller` property. You must respond to the REST response component.

__Output data__:

```js
{
	ip: String, // optional, IP address
	url: String, // optional
	language: String, // optional
	ua: String, // optional, parsed user-agent
	user: Object, // optional
	headers: { key: String }, // optional, request headers
	cookies: { key: String }, // optional, cookies
	payload: {}, // optional, request payload
	query: { key: String }, // optional
	params: { key: String }, // optional
	files: [{ type: String, filename: String, path: String, ext: String, size: Number, width: Number, height: Number, data:Buffer|String }] // optional
}
```

name: RSS reader
author: Total.js
readme:
The component downloads every item from the RSS source. A message on to this `Trigger` input starts downloading RSS data.

__Example__:

```js
{
	title: String,
	description: String,
	link: String,
	image: String, // optional
	date: Date // optional
}
```

name: Script
author: Total.js
readme: This component executes a custom JavaScript code as it is. To send data to the default output use `send(data);`

name: Secrets
author: Total.js
readme:
The component creates secret variables from the input message data. You can read data easily via `{key}` in the component's settings. Keys and their values must be of String type.

```js
{
	key1: value1,
	key2: value2,
	keyN: valueN
}
```

name: Send and wait
author: Total.js
readme: This component sends the data next, and then waits for a defined period.

name: Server extension
author: Total.js
readme: The component installs Total.js server-side extension. In other words: it can evaluate JavaScript code when the component is initialized or the component settings is changed.

name: SMS
author: Total.js
readme: The component sends a SMS message.

name: SMS
author: Total.js
readme:
By using this component, you can send SMS. It utilizes the [Total.js SMS API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#6d220001ni51c).

__Input data:__

```js
{
	to: "+421903163302",
	body: "Your message ..."
}
```

__Output data__:

```js
{ success: true }
```

name: Snapshot
author: Total.js
readme: The component takes a snapshot of the incoming data and the user can reuse saved snapshots in the future.

name: Split
author: Total.js

name: SQL query
author: Total.js
readme: The component executes SQL command on the specifi connection. This component depends on the `API PostgreSQL` component.

name: SQLite3
author: Total.js

name: Stepper
author: Total.js
readme: The component postpones incoming messages. Releasing messages must be done by hand.

name: Stopwatch
author: Total.js
readme: The component runs a simple stopwatch for incomming messages.

name: String Operations
author: Total.js
readme:
This components can apply string operation to your components.

- input: `String`
- output: `String`

name: Subscribe
author: Total.js
readme: The component subscribes to the specific `Output` component.

name: Switch
author: Total.js
readme:
## Source and Path
Use the **Source** dropdown to select where to look for the value to use in the conditions check.
Set a **Path** if the value is not the data itself. It supports dot notation: `position.longitude` or `sensor.0.value` for arrays, it does not support `sensor[0].value`.
**Expression** supports javascript syntax. Should return a value which will be used in condition check as `data`. Available variables: data, repo, variables, variables2
**Expressions example:**
```js
data.value - variables.offset
```

## Conditions
Each of the **Conditions** corresponds to an output in the exact same order. First condition -> First output.

**Operator**
Not all operators work on all data types. For example it is not possible to use `>` or `<` for strings, etc.
*index of* only works for data of type array or string.
**Expression operator**
In this case the **type** field is ignored and the expression in the **value** field must return `true` or `false`. Available variables: data, repo, variables, variables2.
Expressions operator example:
```js
data.value > variables.threshold;
```
or with a conditions
```js
if (typeof data.value !== 'number') return false; else return data.value > parseInt(variables.threshold);
```

**Expression type**
The expression in the **value** field must return a value which will be used in the given operation. Available variables: data, repo, variables, variables2.
Expressions example:
```js
data.value - variables.offset
```

**Between operator** only works with datatype number and the value must be two comma separated values. e.g.: `2,4` so the condition becomes `val > 2 && val < 4`

name: Tangular
author: Total.js
readme:
The component uses server-side implementation of [Tangular template engine](https://docs.totaljs.com/components/40d06002lm50c/).

## Example

__Incomming data__:

```js
{
	app_name: 'Total.js Flow'
}
```

__Template__:

```html
App name: {{ value.app_name }}
```

- `$` type `{MessageInstance}` <https://docs.totaljs.com/total4/40844001ni51c/>

In the example bellow, the $.refs.controller is only available if the message was created by the Route component:

```html
URL: {{ $.refs.controller.url }}
```

name: Telemetry
author: Martin Smola
readme:
The component shows data in a template.
Hovering over the value shows the last update time.
Assuming this incomming data:
```javascript
{
	speed: 1,
	nested: { value: 2 },
	array: [{ value: 3 }]
}
```
The paths bust be defined as:
```
speed         // -> 1
nested.value  // -> 2
array.0.value // -> 3
```

name: Teleport
author: Total.js
readme: The component can teleport (input) message to another teleport (output) component.

name: Throttle
author: Total.js
readme: The component sends only limited count of messages.

name: Timeout
author: Total.js / Pavol Danko
readme: The component starts a timeout and restarts it when a new message arrives.

name: Timer
author: Total.js
readme: The component triggers data into the Flow in the specified interval.

name: TOTP
author: Total.js
readme:
## Time-Based One-Time Password Algorithm

This component can generate a secret and verifies the code (generated via Authenticator app) as a one-time password for 2FA authorization.

- recommended mobile apps: __Google Authenticator__ or __Microsoft Authenticator__

---

__How does it work?__

First, a user must generate a secret via`generate` input in the authenticator app. Then, for verification of the one-time generated password, you need to use the second input `verify,` which needs user secrets.

### `generate` input/output

__Input data__:

- `user {String}` email or user/account name without special characters

__Output data `object` with__:

- `secret {String}` a generated secret which you must store for the specific user
- `url {String}` an optimized url address for tokenization
- `qrcode {String}` a link to the picture with QR code

### `verify` input/outputs

__Input data `object` with__:

- `secret {String}`

__Output data `object` with__:

- `success {Boolean}` determines if the password is valid or not

author: Total.js
readme: This component can transform message data.

author: Total.js

name: Trigger
author: Total.js
readme: The component triggers data into the Flow.

author: Total.js
readme: The component processes files from the Total.js Route component.

name: URL
author: Peter Širka | Total.js
readme: This component checks URL address.

name: Variable symbol
author: Peter Širka / Total.js
readme: The component will generate a variable symbol according to a custom format.

name: Weather
author: Total.js
readme:
By using this component, you can obtain the current weather by an address. It utilizes the [Total.js Weather API](https://docs.totaljs.com/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#128f7001kc51d).

__Input data:__

```js
// {String} address without diacritics
'Banska Bystrica, Slovakia'
```

__Output data__:

```js
{
	name: 'Bratislava',
	temperature: 22,
	wind: 20.2,
	humidity: 65,
	pressure: 1018,
	cloud: 25,
	uv: 6,
	sky: 'Partly cloudy'
}
```

name: WebSocket
author: Total.js
readme:
This component creates a WebSocket endpoint. Initial message data is stored in the memory of new clients.

- `message.data {Object}` data from a WebSocket message
- `message.refs.client {Object}` contains a client controller
- `message.refs.controller {Object}` contains a WebSocket controller

name: XML parser
author: Total.js
